model

Class MapState

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.util.Observable
      • model.MapState

  • public class MapState
extends java.util.Observable
    Class that contains a limited number of map states to be able to navigate between then with undo and redo operations
    Since:
    0.5
    Author:
    Pedro Sampaio

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      MapState(int maxStates)
      Constructor initializes the list of states and stores the limit and initialize remaining properties.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void AddState(Map map)
      Adds a new state to the list of states controlling the size of the list
      void dispatchChanges()
      dispatch changes in the map state for observers
      Map getCurrentMap() 
      boolean isRedoPossible() 
      boolean isUndoPossible() 
      void RedoState()
      Redo to a future state.
      void RemoveOldStates()
      Removes all states from states list except the current one
      void UndoState()
      Undo the current state.
      void UpdateState(Map map)
      Updates current map state

      • Methods inherited from class java.util.Observable

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • MapState

        public MapState(int maxStates)
        Constructor initializes the list of states and stores the limit and initialize remaining properties.
        Parameters:
        maxStates - maximum number of states to save in total

    • Method Detail

      • UpdateState

        public void UpdateState(Map map)
        Updates current map state
        Parameters:
        map - the new data for the current map state
        Since:
        0.7b

      • AddState

        public void AddState(Map map)
        Adds a new state to the list of states controlling the size of the list
        Parameters:
        map - New state to be added
        Since:
        0.5

      • RemoveOldStates

        public void RemoveOldStates()
        Removes all states from states list except the current one
        Since:
        1.2b

      • UndoState

        public void UndoState()
        Undo the current state. Each time this method is called, seek moves one state in the past until the oldest state is reached.
        Since:
        0.5

      • RedoState

        public void RedoState()
        Redo to a future state. Each time this method is called, seek moves one state in the future until the newest state is reached.
        Since:
        0.5

      • isUndoPossible

        public boolean isUndoPossible()
        Returns:
        if is possible undoing a state (there are older states stored)
        Since:
        0.5

      • isRedoPossible

        public boolean isRedoPossible()
        Returns:
        if is possible redoing a state (there are newer states stored)
        Since:
        0.5

      • getCurrentMap

        public Map getCurrentMap()
        Returns:
        the map in the current state that is the actual map to work with
        Since:
        0.5

      • dispatchChanges

        public void dispatchChanges()
        dispatch changes in the map state for observers
        Since:
        0.5
